thread.title: Asmir Begovic will be staying at Chelsea
thread.title_full: Asmir Begovic will be staying at Chelsea | Daily Mail Online

author: Kieran Gill for MailOnline
title: Asmir Begovic will be staying at Chelsea
text:
Asmir Begovic is set to stay at Stamford Bridge because Chelsea know they will not be getting Celtic goalkeeper Craig Gordon.
Antonio Conte wanted to sign a replacement before sanctioning the £10million sale of Begovic to Bournemouth.
It has not worked out, despite Begovic wanting to leave for first-team football as he is currently second choice to Thibaut Courtois at Chelsea.
Asmir Begovic (left) will be staying at Chelsea until the summer at least
Begovic was linked with a £10million move to Bournemouth but the deal has fallen through
Begovic is currently with the squad in Merseyside ahead of their game against Liverpool at Anfield on Tuesday night.
Like Begovic, it is understood Gordon was not interested in playing second fiddle to Courtois and is glad to stay at Celtic.
Celtic manager Brendan Rodgers, speaking on Monday, said there was no question of Gordon departing before the English transfer window closes at 11pm on Tuesday night.
Chelsea were interested in signing Celtic goalkeeper Craig Gordon but no deal can be done
He said: ‘Craig will be in goal on Wednesday night [against Aberdeen] I guarantee you. So write that. That’s all you need to write. He will be in goal.’
Chelsea boss Conte said Begovic would only be sold if a replacement could be brought in before the deadline.
Speaking on Monday, the Italian said: 'Until now I haven't got news about Asmir. I think we have to wait until tomorrow and then we will see the situation.
'Asmir wants to go to play, he wants to play every game. But also he knows really well our situation. If we are able to replace him then he'll go.'
